meanings.definition: A feeling of smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: His complacence after winning the game was evident in his wide grin.
meanings.sent2: She was filled with complacence when she received praise for her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The cat's complacence after catching the mouse was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The complacence of the old tree standing tall in the forest was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The complacence in her voice made it clear she was content with her choices.

meanings.definition: The state of being pleased with oneself or one's situation without realizing potential dangers or flaws.
meanings.sent1: His complacence about the storm led him to ignore the dark clouds gathering.
meanings.sent2: She lived in complacence, unaware of the risks lurking around her.
meanings.sent3: The complacence of the hiker who wandered off the trail was quite amusing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The complacence of the ship captain in the face of the approaching iceberg was concerning.
meanings.sent5: The complacence of the child playing near the busy road worried the parents.
